content:
The digital decluttering process can be so therapeutic! Congratulations on taking the time to tidy up your phone's storage and organize your apps into folders. That must have felt satisfying!

Deleting or uploading old photos and videos to the cloud is a great way to free up storage space and reduce clutter. You might also consider reviewing your apps and uninstalling any that you no longer use or need. This can help improve your phone's performance and reduce battery consumption.

Regarding your contacts list, it's not uncommon to accumulate contacts over time that are no longer relevant or accurate. Taking the time to review and clean up your contacts list can help you stay organized and avoid confusion. You might consider categorizing your contacts into groups, such as friends, family, work, or acquaintances, to make it easier to find specific contacts.

While you're at it, you might also consider reviewing your phone's storage usage to see if there are any other areas where you can free up space. Check your phone's settings to see which apps, files, and data are taking up the most storage space. You might be surprised at what you find!

Now, back to your battery life issues... Given that you've been decluttering your phone's storage, it's possible that your battery life might improve as a result. However, if you're still experiencing issues, we can continue to explore other potential causes.

Here are a few more questions to help us troubleshoot:

1. Have you noticed any changes in your phone's performance or battery life since you started decluttering your storage?
2. Are there any specific times of the day or activities that seem to drain your battery more quickly?
3. Have you tried restarting your phone regularly to clear out any temporary files or cache that might be affecting battery life?

Let's keep working together to optimize your phone's performance and battery life!
